questions.text: A 21-year-old woman with a history of well-controlled HIV receives a Papanicolaou smear to screen for cervical cancer. She is also given a refill for her antiretroviral medications. The Papanicolaou smear is an example of which of the following?
questions.solution:
Secondary prevention focuses on early detection of disease in asymptomatic patients (or while the symptoms of the condition are still mild) to promote early intervention. It involves a two-step process consisting of screening tests to identify disease and follow-up for management of the disease. Some examples of secondary intervention include:
 
  •  Colonoscopy in individuals with inflammatory bowel disease 
  •  Rh blood typing and antibody in pregnant women 
  •  Pap smear in women between 21-29 years 
  •  Blood pressure measurement in high-risk individuals 
  •  Performing DEXA scans in women over 65-years-old to screen for osteoporosis 

Option Analysis

❌ Primordial prevention:
Incorrect: Primordial prevention includes actions that address environmental, socioeconomic, and behavioral risk factors that affect a population as a whole to prevent potential disease or injury. Examples include food safety guidelines or campaigns discouraging tobacco and drug use.  
❌ Primary prevention:
Incorrect: Primary prevention includes actions targeted at preventing specific diseases from occurring, thereby decreasing the incidence and prevalence of such conditions. Examples of primary prevention include vaccination and smoking cessation.  
✅ Secondary prevention:
Correct: See Main Explanation.  
❌ Tertiary prevention:
Incorrect: Tertiary prevention includes actions taken to optimize the care of patients with existing diseases to improve well-being and prevent complications. Examples include adjuvant therapy (e.g. tamoxifen in breast cancer) to reduce the risk of cancer recurrence or blood pressure management (e.g. antihypertensives) to decrease the risk of cardiovascular complications.  
❌ Quaternary prevention:
Incorrect: Quaternary prevention consists of actions taken to avoid unnecessary medical interventions by identifying actions that might harm rather than benefit patients. An example would be minimizing hormone replacement therapy after menopause in order to reduce the risk of cardiovascular events (e.g., stroke, thromboembolism).

questions.text: A 21-year-old female with a history of well-controlled HIV receives a Papanicolaou smear to screen for cervical cancer. She is also given a refill for her antiretroviral medications. The antiretroviral medication refill is an example of which of the following?
questions.solution:
Tertiary prevention consists of actions taken to optimize the care of patients with an existing disease, thereby improving patient well-being and preventing complications. Examples include highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) for the treatment of HIV, adjuvant therapy (e.g. tamoxifen in breast cancer) to reduce the risk of cancer recurrence, and blood pressure management (e.g. antihypertensives) to decrease the risk of cardiovascular events.

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman comes to the office for a routine examination. She is planning to conceive a child with her partner. The physician starts her on prenatal folic acid supplements to reduce the risk of neural tube defects in the fetus. Which of the following best describes this method of disease prevention?
questions.solution:
Primary prevention includes actions targeted at preventing specific diseases from occurring. In other words, primary prevention aims to decrease the incidence and, subsequently, the prevalence of diseases. Some examples include:
 
  •  Immunizations 
  •  Lifestyle modification (e.g., smoking cessation to reduce lung cancer risk, exercise to reduce the risk of heart disease) 
  •  Fortification of salt with iodine to prevent iodine deficiency 
  •  Fluoridation of toothpaste, water, and salt to reduce the risk of dental caries 
  •  Fortification of food with folic acid to reduce the prevalence of neural tube defects

questions.text: A 55-year-old female presents to a primary care provider to establish care. Past medical history is notable for hypertension and ulcerative colitis. The patient has been sexually active with three partners over the past years. She smokes one pack of cigarettes daily. Which of the following is an example of quaternary prevention?

choices.text: Antihypertensives to decrease risk of a cardiovascular event
Colonoscopy in individuals with inflammatory bowel disease
Smoking cessation to reduce lung cancer risk
Ceasing hormone replacement therapy after menopause due to the risk of thromboembolism

questions.solution:
Quaternary prevention consists of actions taken to avoid unnecessary medical interventions by identifying actions that may cause patients harm rather than benefit. Quaternary prevention aims to avoid unnecessary diagnostic studies and treatments without proven efficacy. Some examples include:
 
  •  Avoiding hormone replacement therapy after menopause since the medication increases the risk of thromboembolism 
  •  Avoiding recurrent prostate specific antigen (PSA) testing in men who are not at high risk for prostate cancer 

Option Analysis

❌ Antihypertensives to decrease risk of a cardiovascular event  :
Incorrect: This answer choice is an example of tertiary prevention.  
❌ Colonoscopy in individuals with inflammatory bowel disease:
Incorrect: This answer choice is an example of secondary prevention.  
❌ Smoking cessation to reduce lung cancer risk:
Incorrect: This answer choice is an example of primary prevention.  
✅ Ceasing hormone replacement therapy after menopause due to the risk of thromboembolism:
Correct: See Main Explanation.  
❌ Administration of HPV vaccination:
Incorrect: Primary prevention includes actions targeted at preventing specific diseases from occurring, thereby decreasing the incidence and prevalence of such conditions. Vaccinations are an example of primary prevention.
